title: Dark Horse 2015 Zinfandel (California)
description: A streak of vanilla winds through the almost-sweet fruit flavors of this medium-bodied and soft-textured wine. Ripe cherry aromas and strawberry jam flavors come with very little tannin and low acidity.

title: Demetria 2014 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Key lime and honeysuckle scents show on the nose of this bottling. Pithy green apple flavors and tightly wound tension mark the palate, finishing rather short.

title: Devil's Advocate 2014 One Hundred Percent Red (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh juice aromas and caramelized blackberry scents combine with dark chocolate and a little lavender in this blend of 44% Petite Sirah, 38% Syrah, 10% Mourvèdre and 8% Grenache. Soft, thick and sticky on the palate, it shows tangy plum skin and tart boysenberry flavors, with sharp and strong acidity.

title: Adirondack Winery 2015 Barrel Aged Adirondack Overlook Chardonnay (New York)
description: Slightly dusty oak tones of dill, vanilla and sweet spice accentuate the maturity of this barrel-aged Chardonnay. It's a full bodied, densely textured wine with lingering flavors of dried apple and pear. Drink now.

title: Antica Hirpinia 2015  Fiano di Avellino
description: This wine's nose is initially quite shy, releasing a whiff of Mediterranean herb with some air. The simple palate offers citrus and a saline flavors while crisp acidity gives it a fresh finish.

title: Atwater 2014 Dry Middle Block One Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Crisp pears and apples abound in this light-bodied dry Riesling. It's delicate in concentration but pleasantly lemony. The wine finishes briskly but freshly.

title: Domaine de la Sanglière 2016 La Sanglière Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: Softly fruity, the wine is warm and with gentle red-fruit flavors. It is an easy-quaffing style with just the right amount of acidity and a light caramel and spice aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Domaine D'en Ségur 2016 Le Rosé (Côtes du Tarn)
description: This is a soft and fruity wine. It has gentle acidity and a ripe blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc. The wine, with its strawberry flavor, is immediately attractive. Drink now.

title: Château Coutinel 2016 On l'appelle Negrette (Fronton)
description: Fronton's Négrette grape is found in few other places. Made 100% from the single variety, this wine displays the grape's juicy character as well as the spice and violet aromas and damson flavors. The wine is made to be drunk young.

title: Château de Brigue 2016 Les Meyans Elégance Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: The Cinsault that dominates this blend creates a light and gently fruity wine. It has attractive acidity and just the lightest of red-fruit flavors. The aftertaste is soft and tangy with orange zest.

title: Château de Saint-Martin 2016 Eternelle Favorite Rosé (Côtes de Provence)
description: This Provence cru classé estate has produced a refreshingly fruity wine. With its red-currant and citrus flavors and tight mineral acidity, it is both textured and really crisp. Drink now.

title: Bodegas Aragonesas 2013 Castillo de Fuendejalon Crianza Red (Campo de Borja)
description: Earthy raisin and prune aromas are good in an overripe way. Following the nose, this Garnacha-Tempranillo blend feels dense, thick and chewy. Spicy stewy berry flavors taste chocolaty on a gummy finish.

title: Buttonwood Grove 2015 Dry Riesling (Finger Lakes)
description: Delicate hints of crushed mineral and white flower linger in this dry appley Riesling. Soft acidity lends a slightly broad, flat feel to the palate but the finish is clean and crisp.

title: Otazu 2016 Tempranillo Rosé (Navarra)
description: Basic aromas of fruity Chiclets gum introduce a palate with low acidity and a sense of weight and friction. This plump rosé tastes of spiced melon. The finish is low on verve and thus prematurely soft. Drink immediately for best results.

title: Pascual Toso 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Aromas of matchstick, crushed vitamin and white fruits feed into a lean, hollow palate with surface-level oak. Lemon and oak are the key flavors, while this tastes oaky but feels rather watery on a light finish.

title: Hogue 2013 Genesis Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Light in color, this wine offers aromas of herb, red currant, graphite, raspberry and barrel spice. The fruit and barrel flavors are elegantly styled, playing off each other through the finish.

title: Hogue 2013 Terroir Syrah (Snipes Mountain)
description: Cherry, raspberry compote, anise, vanilla, wood spice and medicine-cabinet aromas are followed by lighter styled fruit and savory flavors, with the tannins bringing some grip.

title: Ironstone 2015 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)
description: This assertive, dry wine has wet stone and cured meat aromas and tart, mouth-cleansing grapefruit and pineapple flavors. It will make a fine foil for rich foods like fettucine alfredo or fried chicken.

title: Ivory and Burt 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Oaky walnut aromas kick off this medium-bodied wine, opening into warmer pear and apple flavors on the palate. It feels dry and reasonably rich in texture.

title: Nativ 2015 Aglianico (Campania)
description: This informal red has subdued baking spice and black-skinned fruit aromas. The simple palate delivers prune and confected notes, alongside chewy tannins. Drink soon.

title: Marqués de Vizhoja 2016 Torre la Moreira Albariño (Rías Baixas)
description: Dusty white-fruit aromas come with notes of green herbs and pyrazines. This feels solid and simple, with some plumpness. Generic papaya and dry melon flavors end with a flavor note of green banana.

title: Martinshof 2015 Zweigelt (Niederösterreich)
description: Red currant and red cherry fruit mark this wine's nose. Its palate is slightly dilute, with an herbal tisane touch. A light-bodied, country-style red that will do well when chilled and in a picnic basket.

title: Maryhill 2014 Painted Hills Vineyard Dolcetto (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Dolcetto remains an extreme rarity in the state. This one brings aromas of black currant, vanilla, licorice and wood spice that are followed by dried-out-seeming fruit flavors along with lightly dry tannins. The oak seems prominent and the variety hard to find at times.

title: Georges Vigouroux 2016 Tradition Familiale Malbec (Comté Tolosan)
description: A purple-colored wine, showing the color of young Malbec. The wine is ripe with great blackberry fruits and juicy acidity. It's a wine to drink young, with a soft texture and gentle acidity. Drink now with a summer barbecue.

title: Ledson 2014 Caudalies Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: Rich, plummy and oaky, this wine combines 52% Zinfandel and 48% Petite Sirah. The two varieties pack a punch of intensity and a plush mouthfeel, finishing with a touch of heat.

title: Lemelson 2015 Dry Riesling (Dundee Hills)
description: This is certainly dry, as stated, but it doesn't have the texture and stuffing that the best dry Rieslings bring to the show. Simple and straightforward lemon and grapefruit flavors tell the whole story, and those high acids leave a sour impression.

title: Les Vins Bréban 2016 Domaine Valfont Rosé (Coteaux d'Aix-en-Provence)
description: Attractively fruity, this is a crisp and light wine. With a touch of caramel under the red fruits, it is lively, with balanced acidity at the end. The wine is ready to drink.

title: Matchbook 2016 Estate Bottled Rosé (Dunnigan Hills)
description: A salmon hue lights up this Tempranillo-based wine. It shows peach and white cherry aromas, fresh but candylike flavors and enough body for a smooth texture.

title: Ross Andrew 2015 The Huntsman Cabernet Sauvignon (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Black-currant, dark-plum and herb aromas are in the lead. The flavors are on the lighter side, with the oak seeming quite dialed back.

title: Santa Sofia 2016 Monte Foscarino  (Soave Classico)
description: This wine's delicate pear, apple and beeswax aromas carry over to the simple, enjoyable palate, along with a citrus note. It's refreshing, with bright acidity.
